title: World wide web inventor predicts VR and spatial computing will transform the internet
description:
Tim Berners-Lee made no mention of crypto or blockchain but seems bullish on the metaverse.

The man credited with creating the world wide web, Tim Berners-Lee, recently gave three predictions for the future of the internet as part of an interview discussing the web’s 35th birthday. According to the tech pioneer, the next chapter of internet history will be defined by AI, VR, and a big tech reshuffle. 

Speaking to CNBC, Berners-Lee said that trustworthy AI assistants would mark a turning point for interaction. "One of the things I predict," said Berners-Lee, “is you will have an AI assistant, which you can trust, and it works for you, like a doctor.”

His second prediction is that humans will gain ownership of their data and that virtual reality (VR) and spatial computing (essentially, being immersed in the metaverse) will become the go-to modality for using computers.

Read more

title: Tether collaborates with FBI to recover $1.4 million in scam targeting seniors
description:
Stablecoin issuer Tether collaborated with the US Department of Justice and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) to seize $1.4 million USDT associated with a tech support scam network, according to a Mar. 12 statement. The fraudulent scheme targeted vulnerable elderly individuals through deceptive pop-up advertisements. These misleading ads falsely alerted victims to compromised devices, […]

title: UK to require NFT issuers to register with financial authority amid crypto regulation overhaul

title: Massive Transfer of Bitcoin Wealth Underway As Investor Sentiment Edges Closer to Euphoria: Analytics Firm Glassnode
description:

In a new report, Glassnode says that as Bitcoin breaks another all-time high, speculators have arrived to open leveraged futures positions, often buying their […]
